dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 521 IH: Ending Presidential Overreach on Public Lands Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Maloy (for herself, Mr. Amodei of Nevada, Mr. LaMalfa, Mr. Gosar, Mr. Moore of Utah, Mr. Begich, Mr. Newhouse, Mr. Stauber, Mrs. Fischbach, Mr. Estes, Mr. Owens, Mr. Kennedy of Utah, and Mr. Fong) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To reserve to Congress the authority to establish or extend a national monument.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Ending Presidential Overreach on Public Lands Act.
Section 320301 of title 54, United States Code (commonly referred to as the Antiquities Act), is amended to read as follows:
The establishment or extension of a national monument may be undertaken only by express authorization of Congress.
